channel.description: Recent content in Home on ISP - PROMETEO

item.title: Session 7 (S7) – Machine learning (foundation models, causality)
item.description: About Event Presentations: Two talks (20+10 min each). Breakout Discussions: Topics entered and voted using Slido.

item.title: Session 8 (S8) – Conclusions and Wrap-up
item.description: About Event Presentation of breakout session outcomes. Consolidated discussion on common themes of complexity and possible solutions across sessions.

item.title: Session 3 (S3) – Earth-Land Systems
item.description: About Event Presentations: Two talks (20+10 min each). Breakout Discussions (1 hour): Topics entered and voted using Slido.

item.title: Session 4 (S4) – Socio-Environmental Systems
item.description: About Event Presentations: Two talks (20+10 min each). Breakout Discussions: Topics entered and voted using Slido.

item.title: Session 5 (S5) – Vision Neuroscience
item.description: About Event Presentations: Two talks (20+10 min each).

item.title: Session 6 (S6) – Vision Image Processing
item.description: About Event Presentations: Tow talks (20+10 min each). Moderated Q&A for both vision sessions

item.title: Introduction to AI4CS and workshop goals
item.description: About Event This session will provide an overview of AI4CS, including its objectives and key challenges:

item.description: About Event Presentations: Two talks (20+10 min each).

item.title: Session 2 (S3) – Earth-Land Systems
item.description: About Event Presentations: One talk (20+10 min). Moderated Q&A for all Earth presentations.

item.title: Anna Jungbluth
item.description: About Me Anna Jungbluth is a Research Fellow at the European Space Agency (ESA), where she works in the Climate Team on machine learning applications for Earth Observation.

item.title: David Chaparro Danon
item.description: About Me David Chaparro Danon is a postdoctoral researcher at CREAF.

item.title: Devis Tuia
item.description: About Me My research focuses on machine learning, remote sensing, and spatial analysis applied to Earth observation.

item.title: Emiliano Díaz
item.description: About Me My background is in statistics, machine learning and causal inference.

item.title: Gustau Camps-Valls
item.description: About Me My research is related to statistical learning for modeling and understanding the Earth system.

item.title: Ioannis N. Athanasiadis
item.description: About Me Ioannis N. Athanasiadis is a Professor and Chair of Artificial Intelligence at Wageningen University & Research (WUR) in the Netherlands.

item.title: Iván Sánchez-López
item.description: About Me My research focuses on narrative within the digital communication framework, with a specific focus on three primary dimensions: mediations and formats, empowerment and creativity.

item.description: About Me My research focuses on narrative within the digital communication framework, with a specific focus on three primary dimensions: mediations and formats, empowerment and creativity.

item.description: About Me I’m interested in understanding human vision from information theoretic principles.

item.title: Jorge Vila Tomás
item.description: About Me My work involves atmospheric radiative transfer models, statistical regression emulation, and image processing algorithms development and optimization.

item.description: About Me My work involves atmospheric radiative transfer models, statistical regression emulation, and image processing algorithms development and optimization.

item.title: Luis Gómez-Chova
item.description: About Me My interests are related to machine learning and signal and image processing.

item.title: Maria Piles
item.description: About Me My research interests include microwave remote sensing, estimation of soil moisture and vegetation biogeophysical parameters and development of multisensor techniques for enhanced retrievals with focus on agriculture, forestry, wildfire prediction, extreme detection, and climate studies.

item.title: Maria Piles
item.description: About Me My research interests include microwave remote sensing, estimation of soil moisture and vegetation biogeophysical parameters and development of multisensor techniques for enhanced retrievals with focus on agriculture, forestry, wildfire prediction, extreme detection, and climate studies.

item.title: Maurizio Mencuccini
item.description: About Me Maurizio Mencuccini is an ICREA Researcher in Plant and Ecosystem Ecology at CREAF.

item.title: Michele Meroni
item.description: About Me Michele Meroni is a Remote Sensing Consultant at SEIDOR and a former Scientific Officer at the Joint Research Centre (JRC) of the European Commission.

item.title: Pierre Gentine
item.description: About Me Pierre Gentine is a Professor in the Department of Earth and Environmental Engineering and the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences at Columbia University.

item.title: Rafael Prieto-Curiel
item.description: About Me Rafael Prieto-Curiel is a faculty member at the Complexity Science Hub (CSH) in Vienna, Austria.

item.title: Valero Laparra
item.description: About Me I’m working in image statistics and vision science. I have developed several methods for density estimation, measure independence, manifold learning and visual quality assessment.

item.title: Valero Laparra
item.description: About Me I’m working in image statistics and vision science. I have developed several methods for density estimation, measure independence, manifold learning and visual quality assessment.

item.title: Vassilis Sitokonstantinou
item.description: About Me I develop causal and explainable machine learning methods using Earth observations and environmental data to estimate the impact of agricultural decisions for sustainable agriculture and food security.

item.title: Vassilis Sitokonstantinou
item.description: About Me I develop causal and explainable machine learning methods using Earth observations and environmental data to estimate the impact of agricultural decisions for sustainable agriculture and food security.
